entry.title: Te'omim Cave (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Te'omim Cave (pictured) in Israel was home to a Bronze Age alabaster quarry, a refuge cave during the Jewish–Roman wars, and a possible center for necromantic activity in late antiquity?

entry.title: 1989 Serbian general election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1989 Serbian general election was the last one-party election in Serbia?

entry.title: 1989 (Taylor's Version) (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that fans of Taylor Swift solved 33 million puzzles in less than a day to find out 1989 (Taylor's Version)'s "vault" tracks?

entry.title: John Romita Sr. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Romita Sr. has been credited with introducing romance comic themes to Spider-Man comic books?

entry.title: Waitangiroto Nature Reserve (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Waitangiroto Nature Reserve is the only known nesting area for the eastern great egret in New Zealand?

entry.title: Ben Brown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ben Brown was the seventh member of his family to play American football for the Ole Miss Rebels?

entry.title: Jews Don't Count (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to David Baddiel's book Jews Don't Count, antisemitism has become perceived as a "second-class racism"?

entry.title: a TV station in St. Louis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one reviewer described a TV station in St. Louis as appearing to be "not serious about the news"?
